questions.title: Which of the following boating safety equipment is required on a personal watercraft:
Why is it important to use HELP position if you are submersed in cold water?
Which of the following is the most suitable place to store a marine fire extinguisher?
Which of the following situations is considered the most dangerous onboard a vessel?
When a storm hits while a vessel is underway, the operator should do which of the following?
Which of the following is a characteristic of a properly fitted personal flotation device (PFD)?
Other than seeking medical attention, what is the best treatment for a hypothermia victim?
Which of the following indicates the PORT side of this vessel?
Which of the following describes hypothermia?
Which of the following is one of the early symptoms of carbon monoxide poisoning?

choices.body: sound signalling device
VHF radio
Manual water pump
It increases survival time by reducing heat loss
It helps you be seen by other boaters who may assist you
It warns other boaters nearby by the potential danger in the area
Along with the boat trailer
Under the seats near the motor
In an open area where it is easily accessible
Not having a tool box on board
Not having enough whistles on board
Not having enough PFD's on board
Takes waves from the port or starboard side, never head on
Ensure that all those onboard are wearing a personal flotation device
Shift all passengers to the highest point onboard the boat
It should be a relatively snug fit
it should rise above the ears and mouth
It should be uncomfortable
Vigorous massage
Slow warming
Hot bath
Front
Right
Left
A drop in water temperature below the normal level
An elevation in body temperature above the normal level
A drop in body temperature below the normal level
